title: Ptah - Creator God & Master Craftsman | Egyptian Mythology
subtitle: Creator God, Patron of Craftsmen and Architects
shortDescription: Ptah is the creator god of Memphis who brought the world into being through thought and speech. Patron of craftsmen, architects, and artisans, depicted as mummified man holding staff. He created through divine utterance, speaking the names of all things to bring them into existence. Husband of Sekhmet , father of Nefertum.
longDescription: Full detailed mythology and worship information coming soon. For now, see related deities and use the corpus search to explore ancient texts mentioning Ptah .
